intro: Gnaphalium reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces numerous tiny yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically surrounded by white to pale yellow bracts. It is often found in moist meadows, marshes, and along stream banks in temperate regions. Gnaphalium reticulatum is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
